doctors.name: Amy Arreaza
doctors.about: Amy graduated as a Family Nurse Practitioner from the University of Utah in 2008. As a FNP she worked in wound care and urgent care prior to joining Clinica Sierra Vista in 2014. She has a special interest in obesity medicine. She enjoys traveling, cooking, and spending time with family and friends.

doctors.name: Andreas G. Ahlas
doctors.about: Sees adult patients (14 years and older). Works as an Assistant Clinical Professor in the Department of Internal Medicine at the University of California, Riverside School of Medicine.

doctors.name: Edwin E. Cabahug
doctors.about: Edwin graduated as a Family Nurse Practitioner from the University of Utah in 2008. As a FNP he worked in wound care and urgent care prior to joining Clinica Sierra Vista in 2014. He has a special interest in obesity medicine. He enjoys traveling, cooking, and spending time with family and friends.

doctors.name: Hector Arreaza
doctors.about: Graduated from medical school in Venezuela. He was a UCLA International Medical Graduate scholar and finished residency in our Rio Bravo Family Medicine Residency Program. He was a chief resident in the first class. Now participates actively in our residency program as a faculty and associate program director. He directs a weekly podcast called Rio Bravo Week.

doctors.name: Marlina Aran
doctors.specialist: Marriage and Family Therapist, Family Medicine
doctors.about: Graduated from medical school in Venezuela. He was a UCLA International Medical Graduate scholar and finished residency in our Rio Bravo Family Medicine Residency Program. doctors.name: Matthew B. Beare
doctors.about: A true-blue Kern County native with deep ties to the Central Valley, Dr. Beare focuses his work on treating those who are often pushed to the margins of our community. From the chronically homeless to those suffering from a variety of Substance Use Disorders. His working philosophy and guiding principal is 'go to the people'. This ideologic approach to patient-centered care has given spawn to his Street Medicine team as well as his robust inclusion of Medication Assisted Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder.
